#summary One-sentence summary of this page.

= Introduction =

The "Virtual Mechanic" app for iPhone/iTouch is a teaching tool that allows users to learn about how things work by virtually dissect machines on a touchscreen. When presented with a machine, users can click and drag components around on the screen so that it feels like the user is dismantling the machine. For each component, users can find out what it does from reading the description in the comments section. The user can contribute to discussion by taking and posting relevant photos and comments for each component or for the machine in general. For each machine, the user is basically presented many layered images that can be selected and dragged around to reveal other images below them.
